metadata.Title: CVE-2017-7435 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In libzypp before 20170803 it was possible to add unsigned YUM repositories without warning to the user that could lead to man in the middle or malicious servers to inject malicious RPM packages into a users system.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7435` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libzypp-bin - 17.6.1-1
libzypp-common - 17.6.1-1
libzypp-config - 17.6.1-1
libzypp1722 - 17.6.1-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> likely requires zypper changes, too

criterions.comment: libzypp package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '17.6.1-1').
